keyMoments.title: McKinley Confronts the Straw Hats
keyMoments.description: McKinley, captain of the White Berets, arrives at Lovely Street to arrest the Straw Hat Pirates for illegal entry into Skypiea. He explains the crime classification system and demands payment of the entrance fee.
keyMoments.significance: Introduces McKinley as the enforcer of Skypiea's laws and establishes the conflict between the Straw Hats and the authorities.
keyMoments.quote: You have committed the crime of illegal entry. You must pay the 1 billion extol entrance fee.

keyMoments.title: McKinley Struck by Nami
keyMoments.description: McKinley is accidentally struck by Nami riding the waver at high speed. He classifies this as a Class 5 crime - assault on an officer.
keyMoments.significance: This assault becomes the catalyst for elevating the Straw Hats to Class 2 criminal status.
keyMoments.quote: This is a Class 5 crime! Assault on an officer of the White Berets!

keyMoments.title: McKinley Declares Class 2 Criminal Status
keyMoments.description: After the White Berets are defeated, McKinley officially designates the Straw Hats as Class 2 criminals who must face judgment by the Priests.
keyMoments.significance: Sets up the major conflicts to come with the four Priests and their Ordeals.
keyMoments.quote: You are now designated as Class 2 criminals! You will face judgment by the Priests!

abilities.description: McKinley uses a Milky Dial for cloud-based transportation and combat maneuvers.

relationships.description: McKinley attempts to arrest the Straw Hats for illegal entry and various crimes against Skypiea law.

evolutionMoments.description: McKinley confronts the Straw Hats as a law enforcement officer enforcing Enel's laws.

reveals.information: Captain of the White Berets, Skypiea's law enforcement
Serves under God Enel as part of his army

keyMoments.title: Gomu Gomu no Hanabi Debut
keyMoments.description: Luffy debuts his Gomu Gomu no Hanabi (Gum-Gum Fireworks) technique, grabbing multiple White Berets soldiers and slamming them all into the ground simultaneously.
keyMoments.significance: First appearance of this technique in the anime, showcasing Luffy's expanding arsenal of Devil Fruit abilities.

keyMoments.title: Luffy Defeats the White Berets
keyMoments.description: Luffy easily defeats the entire White Berets unit with a single attack, demonstrating the vast power gap between Blue Sea pirates and ordinary Sky Island soldiers.
keyMoments.significance: Establishes that the Straw Hats will need stronger opponents (the Priests) to face real challenges in Skypiea.

abilities.description: Luffy grabs multiple opponents, stretches his arms in different directions, then slams them all into the ground at once, creating a fireworks-like effect.

reveals.information: Luffy can use Gomu Gomu no Hanabi to defeat multiple opponents simultaneously

keyMoments.title: Nami Returns on the Waver
keyMoments.description: Nami returns to Lovely Street riding the waver at high speed after exploring the Forbidden Upper Yard, unaware of the confrontation with the White Berets.
keyMoments.significance: Her return sets up the critical moment that escalates the crew's criminal status.

keyMoments.title: Nami Assaults McKinley
keyMoments.description: Nami accidentally crashes into McKinley with the waver, committing a Class 5 crime that escalates the crew to Class 2 criminal status.
keyMoments.significance: This accidental assault becomes the catalyst for the crew facing the Priests and their Ordeals.

keyMoments.title: Conis Witnesses the Confrontation
keyMoments.description: Conis watches with concern as the Straw Hats are designated as Class 2 criminals, understanding the deadly danger they now face.
keyMoments.significance: Shows the perspective of ordinary Skypiea citizens who live in fear under Enel's oppressive system.

keyMoments.title: Pagaya's Concern for the Straw Hats
keyMoments.description: Pagaya witnesses the confrontation and expresses deep concern for the Straw Hats' safety as Class 2 criminals.
keyMoments.significance: Demonstrates how Enel's system instills fear in the population of Skypiea.
